subject: Re: [junit] testing XML APIs
msgSnippet: Thanks Andreas. I just wanted to confirm that. -Harshal ... -- http://shahharshal.blogspot.com/ [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
messageBody:
Thanks Andreas. I just wanted to confirm that.

-Harshal

On 7/6/06, Andreas Guther <Andreas.Guther@...> wrote:
>
> Harshal,
>
> I think there should be no difference in the comparison. For me it is
> just the case the methods I am testing write to an XML stream and the
> most convenient way for me to assert the correctness is via the XML
> files.
>
> Please have a look at the API at http://xmlunit.sourceforge.net/
>
>
> Andreas
>
> ________________________________
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com> [mailto:
> junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com>] On Behalf Of
> Harshal Shah
> Sent: Thursday, July 06, 2006 5:35 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com <junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: Re: [junit] testing XML APIs
>
>
> Andreas,
>
> How different is it from comparing two DOM objects?
>
> -Thanks
> Harshal
>
> On 7/6/06, Andreas Guther <Andreas.Guther@...<Andreas.Guther%40markettools.com>
> <mailto:Andreas.Guther%40markettools.com> > wrote:
> >
> > In case you are interested in testing XML generated by your Java
> > applications, I can recommend XmlUnit. It compare a given XML against
> > an expected XML.
> >
> > Andreas
> >
> > ________________________________
> >
> >
